description: Savor the rich flavors of this chocolate pecan pie with a buttery crust. It's an impressive dessert that will delight your guests and elevate any occasion.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine corn syrup, brown sugar, granulated sugar, and melted butter.
Add eggs and vanilla extract, mixing well until smooth.
Stir in chocolate chips and chopped pecans.
Pour the filling into the prepared pie crust.
Bake for 60 minutes or until the filling is set.
tips: For a perfectly flaky crust, avoid overworking the dough. Let the pie cool completely before slicing to ensure clean cuts. Serve with whipped cream for added indulgence.

note.label: Essential Knowledge
note.content:
• For the best texture, let the pie cool completely before slicing.
  • A common mistake is not allowing the filling to set properly; ensure it bakes until firm.
  • The filling is done when it no longer jiggles in the center.
  • Store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

structured_content.content: Sharing this chocolate pecan pie with family always brings smiles. It's a reminder that desserts can be simple yet extraordinary, and watching everyone enjoy a slice makes it all worthwhile.
Consider adding a splash of bourbon for depth, or a sprinkle of sea salt on top for contrast. A dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream elevates the experience.
Pair this pie with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or serve it alongside fresh whipped cream for a delightful contrast. A side of coffee or hot cocoa complements the rich flavors perfectly.
For a gluten-free version, use a gluten-free pie crust. You can also substitute the chocolate chips with dark chocolate for a richer flavor.
